alert.note: Alert for Grundy; Southern Will (Illinois) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Chicago (Northeastern Illinois and Northwestern Indiana)
info.headline: Flash Flood Watch issued February 20 at 10:48AM CST until February 21 at 12:00PM CST by NWS Chicago
info.description: ...FLASH FLOOD WATCH FOR AN ICE JAM NOW IN EFFECT THROUGH MONDAY MORNING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by an ice jam continues to be possible. * WHERE...A portion of northeast Illinois, including the following areas, Grundy and Southern Will. * WHEN...Through Monday morning. * IMPACTS...Localized flooding of low lying areas and property along the river may occur upstream and downstream of the ice jam. Rapid water level fluctuations may occur due to heavy ice cover on the river. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - River gauge observations continue to indicate heavy river ice and ice jamming just downstream of I-55. Rapid water level fluctuations may continue over the next few days while the ice jam remains in place. Flooding may occur upstream if the jam worsens or downstream if the jam breaks up. Flooding may occur with little notice. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: You should monitor later forecasts and be prepared to take action should Flash Flood Warnings be issued.
